revision.text:
[[File:SolarGIS-Solar-map-Romania-en.png|thumb|upright=1.25|alt=Solar map of Romania|Solar [[insolation]] in Romania]] '''Solar power in Romania''' had an installed capacity of 1,374 [[megawatt]] (MW)https://www.eurobserv-er.org/pdf/photovoltaic-barometer-2018-en/ {{cite web |website = http://www.iea-pvps.org/index.php?id=trends |url = http://www.iea-pvps.org/fileadmin/dam/public/report/statistics/IEA_PVPS_Trends_2014_in_PV_Applications_-_lr.pdf |title = IEA PVPS TRENDS 2014 in Photovoltaic Applications |format = PDF |page = 33 |date = 12 October 2014 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141228113645/http://www.iea-pvps.org/fileadmin/dam/public/report/statistics/IEA_PVPS_Trends_2014_in_PV_Applications_-_lr.pdf |archivedate = 28 December 2014 |url-status = live }} as of the end of 2017. The country had in 2007 an installed capacity of 0.30 MW, which increased to 3.5 MW by the end of 2011,[http://www.eurobserv-er.org/pdf/photovoltaic_2012.pdf Photovoltaic barometer] and to 6.5 MW by the end of 2012. However, the record year of 2013 was an exception, and new installation fell back from 1,100 MW to a moderate level of 69 MW in 2014. [[Romania]] is located in an area with a good solar potential of 210 sunny days per year and with an annual solar energy flux between 1,000 [[kilowatt-hour|kWh]]/m2/year and 1,300 kWh/m2/year. From this total amount around 600 to 800 kWh/m2/year is technically feasible.{{cite web|url=http://www.wagner-solar.ro/|title=Beneficiaţi de avantajele energiei solare|year=2007|publisher=Wagner Solar|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060821190237/http://www.wagner-solar.ro/|archive-date=2006-08-21|url-status=dead}} The most important solar regions of Romania are the [[Black Sea]] coast, [[Northern Dobruja]] and [[Oltenia]] with an average of 1,600 kWh/ m2/year.{{cite web|url=http://www.termo.utcluj.ro/regenerabile/2_1.pdf|title=Energia solara in Romania|year=2008|publisher=Universitatea Tehnica Cluj|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25}} Romania was a major player in the solar power industry, installing in the 1970s and 1980s around {{convert|800000|m2|ft2|abbr=on}} of low quality solar collectors that placed the country third worldwide in the total surface area of PV cells.{{cite web|url=http://www.energie-gratis.ro/energia_solara.php|title=PANOURI TERMICE SOLARE|year=2007|publisher=Energie Gratis|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25}} One of the most important solar projects was the installation of a 30 kW solar panel on the roof of the [[Politehnica University of Bucharest]] that is capable of producing 60 MWh of electricity per year.{{cite web|url=http://www.agir.ro/univers-ingineresc/centrala_fotovoltaica_de_30_kw_1482.html|title=CENTRALA FOTOVOLTAICA DE 30 kW|year=2006|publisher=Asociatia Generala a Inginerilor din Romania|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201040401/http://www.agir.ro/univers-ingineresc/centrala_fotovoltaica_de_30_kw_1482.html|archive-date=2008-12-01|url-status=dead}} Rominterm, a Romanian company, by 2010, installed a total of 600 solar panels in [[Mangalia]], [[Constanţa County]] making the city self-sufficient in terms of heated water during the summer months and providing around 70% of heated water in the winter months and another 1,150 solar panels used for the generation of electricity spread over an area of {{convert|1400|m2|ft2|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.ghidelectric.ro/stire-405-Centrale-solare-in-Romania.html|title= Centrale solare in Romania|date=2008-12-09|publisher=Ghid elelctric|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25}} Another Romanian city, [[Alba Iulia]], installed a total of 1,700 PV cells on several public buildings that have a rated power of 257 kW.{{cite web|url=http://www.ecomagazin.ro/alba-iulia-mizeaza-pe-soare/|title=Alba Iulia mizează pe soare|date=2009-02-23|publisher=Ecomagazin|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25}} Other cities include [[Giurgiu]] with 174 solar panels and 391.5 kW installed capacity and [[Saturn, Romania]] with 50 panels and 112 kW installed capacity.{{cite web|url=http://www.terraiii.ngo.ro/index.stm?apc=ei-r0x1--&x=28288|title=Energia solara|date=September 2007|publisher=Terra Mileniului III|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-02-25|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111006180008/http://www.terraiii.ngo.ro/index.stm?apc=ei-r0x1--&x=28288|archive-date=2011-10-06|url-status=dead}} == Installed PV capacity and Yearly production == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ History of PV deployment |- ! consumption

colspan=5 style="font-weight: normal; font-size: 0.85em; text-align: left; padding: 6px 2px 4px 4px;" |''Source:'' latest IEA-PVPS,{{cite web |url=http://www.iea-pvps.org/fileadmin/dam/public/report/technical/PVPS_report_-_A_Snapshot_of_Global_PV_-_1992-2014.pdf |title=Snapshot of Global PV 1992-2014 |page=15 |website=iea-pvps.org/index.php?id=32 |publisher=International Energy Agency — Photovoltaic Power Systems Programme |date=30 March 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150407023056/http://www.iea-pvps.org/index.php?id=92&eID=dam_frontend_push&docID=2430 |archivedate=7 April 2015 |url-status=live}} previous[http://www.eurobserv-er.org/pdf/baro202.pdf EurObserv’ER 202: Photovoltaic Barometer][http://www.eurobserv-er.org/pdf/baro196.pdf EurObserv’ER 196: Photovoltaic Barometer][http://www.pv-nms.net/pvnms/web/article?article=yes&id=137 PV Power] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728153615/http://www.pv-nms.net/pvnms/web/article?article=yes&id=137 |date=2013-07-28 }}[http://www.energies-renouvelables.org/observ-er/stat_baro/observ/baro-jdp9.pdf Photovoltaic Barometer]https://www.eurobserv-er.org/photovoltaic-barometer-2018/https://www.eurobserv-er.org/pdf/photovoltaic-barometer-2017-en/https://www.eurobserv-er.org/category/all-photovoltaic-barometers/http://www.transelectrica.ro |} == Projects == Many photovoltaic projects are planned for Romania, totaling over 200 MW, and of these, about 61 MW were expected to be completed by 2012. The first two industrial scale solar power plants in the country are the [[Singureni Solar Park]] completed in December 2010,[http://www.rnvgroup.com/solar_international.php Presence on the International Photovoltaic Market] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.today/20120914060121/http://www.rnvgroup.com/solar_international.php |date=2012-09-14 }} and the Scornicesti Photovoltaic Park, completed 27 December 2011. Each is 1 MW.[http://www.rnvgroup.com/news.php News The second industrial-sized PV park in Romania is commissioned] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120630083338/http://www.rnvgroup.com/news.php |date=2012-06-30 }} The [[Covaci Solar Park]] will be [[Romania|Romania's]] largest solar power plant at completion having a total of 480,000 solar panels with a combined capacity of 35 megawatts, and will be located in [[Timiș County]].{{cite web|url=http://www.standard.ro/articol_96102_12/cj_timis_vrea_sa_construiasca_un_parc_cu_panouri_solare__pe_o_suprafata_de_60_de_hectare.html|title=CJ Timis vrea sa construiasca un parc cu panouri solare, pe o suprafata de 60 de hectare|date=2009-05-27|publisher=Business Standard|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-05-27}}{{dead link|date=May 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Another important site is the [[Gura Ialomiţei Solar Park]] in [[Ialomiţa County]] which will have a capacity of 10 megawatts.{{cite web|url=http://www.ghidelectric.ro/stire-695-Avem-primul-parc-solar-care-produce-electricitate.html|title=Avem primul parc solar care produce electricitate|date=2009-10-20|publisher=ghidelectric.ro|language=Romanian|accessdate=2009-10-28}} Other solar parks include the [[Satu Mare Solar Park]] located in [[Satu Mare County]] which will have a capacity of 5 to 8 megawatts{{cite web|url=http://www.portalsm.ro/Satu-Mare/Administrativ/In-locul-gropii-de-gunoi-va-fi-amenajat-un-parc-de-panouri-solare_2191.aspx |title=În locul gropii de gunoi va fi amenajat un parc de panouri solare |date=2010-08-11 |publisher=portalsm.ro |language=Romanian |accessdate=2010-08-27 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100816043423/http://www.portalsm.ro/Satu-Mare/Administrativ/In-locul-gropii-de-gunoi-va-fi-amenajat-un-parc-de-panouri-solare_2191.aspx |archivedate=August 16, 2010 }} and the [[Sfântu Gheorghe Solar Park]] located in [[Covasna County]] that will have a capacity of 2.4 megawatts.{{cite web|url=http://www.financiarul.ro/2010/07/02/solar-park-to-be-built-near-sfantu-ghorghe/|title=Solar park to be built near Sfantu Ghorghe|date=2010-07-02|publisher=financiarul.ro|language=Romanian|accessdate=2010-08-27}} A 32 MW project in four sections of 8 MW each is planned for [[Gătaia]], and a 48 MW solar park is planned for [[Segarcea]].[http://see-industry.com/industrial-statii.aspx?br=47&rub=255&id=681 South-East European PV Market Review] == Government support == The Romanian State supports the production of solar / PV energy by offering six (6) green certificates for each MWh produced and injected into the grid. One green certificate will be traded on a regulated market (i.e. OPCOM) with a price that varies between EUR 27 to EUR 55 per green certificate, subject to indexation with the Euro zone inflation rate. However, due to the reduction of the cost of technology, the Romanian Energy Regulatory Body (i.e. ANRE) considers reducing the number of green certificate in the first half of 2012. In order to protect the interest of the solar / PV producers and for an appropriate guidance through the Romanian RES-E issues, the Romanian Photovoltaic Industry Association[http://www.rpia.ro/ Website] was created. Solar / PV energy is expected to be the second most active developed [[Energy development|source of energy]], after wind. {{Clear}} ==See also== {{div col|colwidth=25em}} * [[Photovoltaics]] * [[Growth of photovoltaics]] * [[Solar power by country]] * [[Solar power in the European Union]] * [[Energy in Romania]] * [[Wind power in Romania]] * [[Geothermal power in Romania]] * [[Hydroelectricity in Romania]] * [[List of renewable energy topics by country|Renewable energy by country]] {{div col end}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20160127062220/http://romaniasolarenergy.blogspot.com/ Romania Solar and Renewable Energy] * [http://www.wolftheiss.com Renewable energy guide published by Wolf Theiss] {{Solar parks in Romania}} {{Solar power in Europe}} {{Economy of Romania}} {{Renewable energy by country}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Solar power in Romania| ]]
